text: Any robust, mature forecasting libraries in Julia? Mainly looking for things like ARMA, ARIMA, bonus points for prophet

elements.text: Any robust, mature forecasting libraries in Julia? Mainly looking for things like ARMA, ARIMA, bonus points for prophet

text: There is TSAnalysis.jl, but I'm not sure how mature it is

elements.text: There is TSAnalysis.jl, but I'm not sure how mature it is

text: I think the answer is no - `RCall` to `forecast` and `prophet` are your best bets.

elements.text: I think the answer is no -

text: I had high hopes for TSAnalsysis, but this doesn't look too encouraging: <https://github.com/fipelle/TSAnalysis.jl/graphs/contributors>

elements.text: I had high hopes for TSAnalsysis, but this doesn't look too encouraging:

text: I think part of the problem is that `forecast` in R is so well maintained and feature complete as well as simple to use that it will be very hard to get close with a Julia implementation, let alone improve on it, plus using RCall is pretty straightforward so the effort/benefit ratio of developing `JuliaForecast` is just not such that many people would be interested in working on it
